author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1650169459}
review:
Canvas The Gallery is not a game.  Games contain meaningful gamelike interaction and game loops, which are absent in this software.  It's a 3D rendered ripoff of the MS-Paint drawing application, with one gimmick, the software allows you to share your gallery with other users of the software.  Surely better than the old method of saving your MS-Paint picture and attaching it in an email to your disappointed parents.  While the technical implementation for the software is passable, the chief problem really is that this is not a game.

For those unfamiliar with what actually makes something a game, a "game loop" describes the interaction and feedback a gamer has when playing a game.  Tetris, for example, has a game loop where a random block appears, the gamer interacts with the block to position it, and then the game decides if that finishes a row or not, increases the players score if any rows were completed, then gives the gamer another block to position.  Counter-Strike has a game loop where a player seeks another player, tests their skill against that player by shooting them or being shot, the computer rewards the player if they win, and then if the player survives, they repeat that loop.  There's no loop here, no true interactive feedback.  It simply is not a game, it cannot be "played". 

This has misleadingly been launched in the "Games" section of Steam instead of the "Software" section. This is a common mistake for developers who are new to Steam, or don't understand the difference between games and software which isn't a game.  It seems this software published incorrectly as a game is simply lack of experience/knowledge of the correct process.

Here's a link for the process to publish non-game software on Steam: 

[url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/wizard/HelpWithPublishing?issueid=925]Steam Developer Help With Software Publishing[/url]

It's unfortunate this process was not known about/followed, resulting in a software application being published in the wrong place.

Publishing things which aren't games on Steam in the Games section as games is misleading to gamers and somewhat harmful, because it pollutes the Steam marketplace and takes away visibility and market exposure for genuine game developers who do the right thing and make games for gamers.

There are no gameplay loops in this software, no "gameplay", no meaningful game like interaction. It's a software application and as such has no merits as a video game for gamers. Because of this, I cannot recommend this non-game software as a game to gamers.  This software isn't even completely free as you're expected to pay $2 USD to unlock additional MS Paint paintbrush tools in an "artist pack".

author: {'steamid': '76561198143740817', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1609218924}
review:
Canvas the Gallery is a simple, casual indie game where you take control of a white art gallery and are let loose to paint whatever it is you see fit on the canvases in the art gallery and also the walls. The moment I making art I fell in love with the simple creativity fostered in the game. This game helped foster my true creativity as I established art all around my art gallery for the viewers to see. Who knew that making art could be so fun and addicting...

The game is a very effective game to play to just relax and make art, the Chopin piano music to accompany your painting activity also aids in calmness and relaxation. The number of different tools and stencils you are given not to mention the artist pack which you can get for cheap which gives you more shapes/designs for more creative freedom. All in all, I enjoyed my few hours in the game, and Canvas the Gallery is a game I will leave installed and continue to come back to as it has a lot of replayability in being able to make whatever art creations you see fit.  

I thought the game, for being simple in style, is put together nicely. The skylights in the gallery are a nice design touch and the little bit of the city and cars passing by outside the gallery. There are only a few ideas/suggestions that I have that I am sure other people have brought up in their own reviews. I feel like an undo button might be a good addition so that if you make a mistake you can just undo it rather than having to paint over the area if you changed your mind on a design or made a mistake on the canvas. Also, a multiplayer mode would be fun but I understand that it can be a lot to set up, but it would make the game even better to be able to hang out and paint with friends. Although this feature might not be added anytime soon, at all as there is easy file sharing of galleries which can be done among two or more friends. Furthermore, the ability to import any picture into your gallery is a unique feature that most developers might not have added if they were making the game themselves. 

In conclusion, Canvas the Gallery is a simple game that lets you unleash your creative spirit onto an empty art gallery using the spray paint can and the stencils that you are provided. This is a game that you can get a lot of hours and enjoyment out of if you are a creative type of person. If you have not checked this game out already, I recommend you give it a try and start your own art gallery. I truly believe that the experience is worth it.

review:
I guess I shouldn't complain about a free game, but there isn't anything to it.  It is exactly as described and it delivers exactly what it says, but I lost interest quickly.  I would like it more with an 'undo' and some sort of measurement of gallery visitor reactions (like a tally of how many people visited and percentage or count of their reactions to various paintings -- and maybe a way to mark a painting 'ready' so visitors aren't critiquing blank canvases). 

Pros: 
nice music
nice reactions from gallery visitors
nice stencils, though limited 
relaxing

Cons: 
no undo 
no mirroring effect
limited rotation options
the extra stencils you can buy are more numerous, but a stencil is a stencil.
gallery visitors don't count for anything, so there's no point trying to please some majority (which, to be fair, isn't that different from the actual art world)

Overall, the controls are too limited to let you do any meaningful 'art' so to make something nice, you are better off editing elsewhere and manually adding to your gallery -- but then why are you bothering to add anything to gallery rather than posting it to your favorite website?

review:
Not the most detailed or intense game, but perfect for when you just want something simple and relaxing.

In this game, you decorate canvases in an art gallery using spray paint. That's it. It's a simple concept, but the fact that there's so much you can do with it makes this a very fun game that you could potentially spend hours on.

The controls are simple and easy to figure out, meaning you can dive right in and start painting. The game gives you a choice between many different shapes for painting, and instead of choosing from pre-selected colors, you get a slider so you can choose any color you want (a feature which I am [i]very[/i] happy about).

There's also some classy-sounding piano music, some funny-looking people who occasionally pop in to see your work, and a nice city scape outside to provide atmosphere.

There's not much else I can say. This is a simple game about spray painting that makes spray painting fun!

EDIT: Amazingly, it's been exactly one year since I last edited this review. I've known this for a while, but I just wanted to update this to say that the "classy-sounding piano music" is actually Chopin's Waltz in A-Flat Major. Just throwing that out there...

갤러리 제작 게임.

플레이어는 새하얀 갤러리의 주인입니다.
주변을 둘러보면 보이는 것은 하얀 벽과 하얀 캔버스!!
천장에는 구멍이 뚫려 하늘이 보이고 닫혀있는 문 너머로는 도로와 차들이 보입니다.

플레이어는 이곳에서 자유롭게 플레이하면 됩니다.
아무런 주제로 아무런 제제도 아무런 방해도 없는 이곳에서
자신의 상상력을 마음껏 발휘하여 그리고 쓰고 난장판으로!!!

WASD로 이동하고, 마우스 좌클릭으로 그리기, 우클릭은 색 담기, 휠로 크기 조정.
스페이스바로 아트 화면을 오픈하여 색상을 변경하거나
특정 문양 등을 선택하여 사용할 수 있습니다.
DLC를 사면 더 많은 문양을 사용할 수 있다는 점!

그림을 그리다보면 관객들이 나타나 그림을 관찰합니다.
딱히 평가한다거나 그런건 아니지만, 웃는 표정 화난 표정 무표정한 얼굴 등에 움찔하기도 하죠.
오히려 너무 자유로워서 무엇을 해야할지 난감한 기분도 드는 게임.

아쉬운 점
-이동이 살짝 답답함/ 점프 기능이 없으니 어색
-자유로워서 오히려 불편한 기분도?

review:
Canvas The Gallery ist kein Spiel an sich, sondern ein Programm um Bilder zu erstellen und mit Freunden zu Teilen. Ich pack das mal bei "Lernspielen" ins Archiv. Denn man kann sich auf "spielerische" Weise mit Kunst und Bildgestaltung beschäftigen. Die Möglichkeiten im Programm selbst zur Erstellung von Bilder ist recht begrenzt. Interessant ist aber die Möglichkeit sehr einfach Bilder auf dem Computer auf diese Weise mit Freunden zu teilen die sich die Bilder in einer virtuellen Galerie betrachten können. 
Interessante Idee, allerdings sollte das Importieren der Bilder noch etwas vereinfacht werden und die eigenen Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für das Erstellen von Bilder wie auch der Galerie selbst noch erweitert werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059347337', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1491440873}
review:
Really neat free tool. I exchanged photos with friends and it was really fun making a game out of it. Out of all, I totally reccomend you play, but if you want to know more, read below.


Canvas The Gallery is an artistic game to "Express Yourself".  Albeit that could totally be what it's used for, I just fucked around in it, spraypainted the walls and pissed off my visitors. The game is amazing, although it does deserve more mechanics, maybe this game could be turned into the classic Artist sim, where you create your art and then sell it to unsuspecting customers who think it looks like total shit and tip you 4 dollars, because they're dissapointed but still feel bad. All jokes aside, the game needs a bit more polish but I think it really just needs better models, textures, sounds and a new UI. The plain, basic UI of this game is boring and bland compared to the game and its' creativity. I reccomend a UI creator for the community, possibly a workshop for it because like I mentioned before, it looks bad. Really bad. The spray paint animations need a bit of redoing, especially when switching to a new color because a mist of the color you chose goes everywhere and just doesn't make much sense. The model doesn't look the best, but it's not that important. I do feel that there needs to be a day-night cycle in the game just because, it'd be nice to see the paintings in different, more ambient lighting. Possibly a new place to paint or a different section with different sized canvases.

Overall, this game is great and is definetely deserving of a go, being free and all. And I totally think you should buy the DLC, it may not be much and you may not use it every day, but the devs need the money so that they can update this game and possibly make it into much more than it already is. I love this game.


Tl;Dr: Get the game, and get the DLC if you can afford it. The game needs a bit of polish but is great. I reccomend.

review:
This is a pretty neat game to just screw around with for free, but if I were to improve it in anyway, I would:
[list]
 [*] Make it so you could be able to crouch & use a ladder or something.
 [*] Multiplayer of some sort, to make it possible for you and your friends to draw dicks, [i]together[/i].
 [*] Maybe a means of putting a little cassete player in your hands or something. That you can use to swap to either, play your own music, that you could somehow import into the game. Or maybe some original works. While you paint.
 [*] Mac & Linux support. (I dont know much about Unity but I imagine it wouldnt be too hard to do)
 [*] & Generally more tools to change how the brush works. (hardeness, shape, ink pen, etc)
[/list]
But for now, I've spent maybe 45 minutes playing this game, making only a few paintings. Though I intend to spend many more on it. There is something kinda fun to just kicking back, playing some music, and painting as many dicks as you damn well please.
